docs.snippet: One sensation stands out beyond even those of shock and horror over the killing of Dan A. Mitrione by the Tupamaro terrorists in Uruguay: the utter senselessness of this murder. Only diseased minds could see in the gunning down of this father of nine...
docs.lead_paragraph: One sensation stands out beyond even those of shock and horror over the killing of Dan A. Mitrione by the Tupamaro terrorists in Uruguay: the utter senselessness of this murder. Only diseased minds could see in the gunning down of this father of nine from Indiana the weakening of the capitalist system or the advancement of social revolution in the Americas.

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Aug. 10 President Jorge Pacheco Areco's decision not to yield to the demands of terrorist guerrillas, which prompted their murder of an American hostage yesterday, was entirely consistent with his record as a roughand-tumble...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Aug. 10 President Jorge Pacheco Areco's decision not to yield to the demands of terrorist guerrillas, which prompted their murder of an American hostage yesterday, was entirely consistent with his record as a roughand-tumble politician while chief executive of this small nation.
docs.abstract: pol situation and Pacheco adm revd in light of kidnappings; nation is leading Latin-Amer experiment in both elective democracy and socialism, had known no terrorism until last 2 yrs; Pacheco efforts to deal with desperate inflation, which wiped out much of middle class, and lagging productivity discussed; his increasing authoritarianism noted

headline.main: Unruly Uruguay and a Stubborn President

byline.original: By MALCOLM W. BROWNE Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Aug. 10 A State Department spokesman said today that the United States had not pressed Uruguay to meet the demands of the kidnappers of Dan A. Mitrione.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Aug. 10 A State Department spokesman said today that the United States had not pressed Uruguay to meet the demands of the kidnappers of Dan A. Mitrione.
docs.abstract: US State Dept, scoring Uruguayan kidnapping-murder of Amer adviser D A Mitrione, says US did not press Uruguay to meet guerrilla demands because it might encourage other extremists and endanger other Amers abroad; is protecting diplomatic personnel, will not reduce staffs

headline.main: U.S. Says It Didn't Press Uruguay to Yield

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Aug. 11 The body of Dan A. Mitrione, an American hostage who was slain by terrorists, was flown to the United States tonight, accompanied by his widow and their nine children.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Aug. 11 The body of Dan A. Mitrione, an American hostage who was slain by terrorists, was flown to the United States tonight, accompanied by his widow and their nine children.
docs.abstract: body flown to US with wife and 9 children

headline.main: SLAIN AIDE'S BODY ON WAY TO THE U.S.; Police Adviser Was Victim of Terrorists Still Holding 2

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Aug. 11 The State Department announced today that Uruguay planned to erect a memorial in Montevideo to Dan A. Mitrione, the American slain by Uruguayan terrorists, and to name a street there after him.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Aug. 11 The State Department announced today that Uruguay planned to erect a memorial in Montevideo to Dan A. Mitrione, the American slain by Uruguayan terrorists, and to name a street there after him.
docs.abstract: Uruguay to erect Montevideo memorial to Mitrione and name street after him

headline.main: Uruguayans Will Erect A Memorial to Mitrione

docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Aug. 11 An appeal in strong terms for the lives of two hostages held by terrorists in Uruguay was issued by Secretary General Thant today.
